name: Quality Control Thresholds
description: Numeric thresholds for defects and pass/fail grading

theory.natural_language: Batch A passes if critical defects are zero and minor defects are fewer than five. Any critical defect fails the batch. Rework is allowed once if minor defects are between five and ten. Batches with more than ten minor defects fail. Batch B has one critical defect. Batch C has six minor defects. Batch D has zero critical and three minor defects.

expected_answer.natural_language: No. Batch B has a critical defect, so it fails.
Yes. Six minor defects fall in the 5–10 range; rework is allowed once.

queries.natural_language: Should Batch D be accepted as-is?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. Zero critical and only three minor defects meet the pass criteria.
